meaning_mnemonic: If you were to look at a <radical>giant</radical> from above, this is what you would see. Do you see the head and two arms? The giant is facing towards the right.

You stick an umbrella with a big slide on it into the mountainside to make your <radical>barracks</radical>. You're going to use these barracks to teach soldiers how to slide slides and hide from bad weather. It's ingenious!

The life thread is cut with a sword by the Moirai. They are, in Greek mythology, the ones who decide when to let you die, by cutting your life thread. This is probably most well known in the story of <radical>Hercules</radical>, so we'll go with that with this radical.
This radical is the same as the kanji. It means <radical>specialty</radical>.
I don't know what this thing is, but it's <radical>lovely</radical>. It has two eyes, a funny mouth, and a scraggly beard. It's lovely, and nothing else, okay? So remember it that way.
A big lip ring is a pretty <radical>odd</radical> thing to have. If it's big, it'll stretch your lip out, which is odd too.
The meaning of this radical is the same as the alternative kanji meaning. It means <radical>before</radical>.
